intro: Hieracium phaeoprasum, commonly known as the purple hawkweed, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its hairy, upright stems and clustered, yellow-orange flowers that bloom in summer. The leaves are typically heart-shaped and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Native to Europe and parts of Asia, it thrives in meadows and grassy areas. This species is known for its ability to spread through rhizomes, making it a persistent weed in certain habitats.
